pyavia.struct¶

Contents¶

pyavia.struct.mohr2d

Mohr’s circle transformation of stresses in any orientation to principle axes or another nominated angle.

pyavia.struct.sn_raithby

S-N data for complete wings and tailplanes by Raithby (RAeS), using best fit equations of Sewell and Douglas as given in Appendix I of R_air.

Members¶

pyavia.struct provides functions relating to structures, stress analysis, fatigue and damage tolerance.

pyavia.struct.kt_hole3d(rt: float, bt: float, zt: float, rw: float, lcase: str) → float¶

Computes the three-dimensional stress concentration in countersunk and straight shank rivet holes. Original FORTRAN version developed by Kunigal N. Shivakumar and J. C. Newman, Jr. April 1991. Adapted to Python by Eric J. Whitney, April 2020.

Note

A countersink angle of \(\theta_c\) = 100° is assumed by the code which is typical for aircraft fasteners. However as indicated in NASA-TP-3192 page 5 the method is accurate to ±3.5% for \(\theta_c\) ± 10°, i.e. \(\theta_c\) = 90° → 120°.

Parameters

  • rt (float) – Hole radius to thickness ratio, \(0.25 \leq r/t \leq 2.5\).

  • bt (float) – Straight shank length to plate thickness ratio, \(0 \leq b/t \leq 1\). If bt == 1 the hole is straight shank only.

  • zt (float) – Location where stress concentration factor is required as a ratio of plate thickness, \(-0.5 \leq z/t \leq 0.5\). .. note: z is measured from the mid-plane of the plate.

  • rw (float) – Hole radius to plate half-width, \(r/w < 0.25\).

  • lcase (str) –

    Loading case from one of the following options:

    • Straight shank:

      • ’tension’: Remote tension.

      • ’bending’: Remote bending.

      • ’pin’: Pin (or rivet) loading.

      • ’wedge’: Wedge loading.

    • Countersunk hole:

      • ’tension’: Remote tension.

      • ’bending’: Remote bending.

Returns

kt – Three-dimensional stress concentration factor (or \(K_t\)). Depending on load case:

  • Remote tension: \(K_t=\sigma_{max}/\sigma_t\) where \(\sigma_t\) is the remote applied stress.

  • Remote bending: \(K_b=\sigma_{max}/[6M/(t^2)]\) where M = remote applied moment per unit width.

  • Pin (or rivet) load: \(K_p=\sigma_{max}/[P/(2rt)]\) where P = pin load.

  • Wedge load: \(K_w=\sigma_{max}/[P/(2rt)]\) where P = wedge load

Note

K / SCF for simulated rivet loading is obtained by adding one-half of the SCF for remote tension S = p/(2wt) and one-half of the SCF for wedge loading (2w is total width of plate).

Return type

float

pyavia.struct.mohr2d(s_xx: Any, s_yy: Any, t_xy: Any, rot_ang: Any = None)¶

Mohr’s circle transformation of stresses in any orientation to principle axes or another nominated angle.

Parameters

  • s_xx (scalar) – Stress along local x-x axis.

  • s_yy (scalar) – Stress along local y-y axis.

  • t_xy (scalar) – Shear stress in local x-y directions.

  • rot_ang (None or float) –

    Rotation angle (radians if no units given, default = None):

    • If None, returns stresses transformed to principle axes, i.e. \(\sigma_{11}\), \(\sigma_{22}\) and always \(\tau_{12} = 0\).

    • If supplied returns stresses transformed by the specified rotation (i.e. axis x-x → x’-x’).

Returns

s_xx’, s_yy’, t_xy’, rot_ang – Transformed stresses and rotation angle (computed for principle axes if rot_ang was None).

Return type

scalar, float

pyavia.struct.sn_raithby(s_range: pyavia.core.containers.ValueRange)¶

S-N data for complete wings and tailplanes by Raithby (RAeS), using best fit equations of Sewell and Douglas as given in Appendix I of R_air. Hangartner, ‘Correlation of Fatigue Data for Aluminium Aircraft Wing and Tail Structures’, National Research Council Canada, Ottawa, Aeronautical Report LR-582, Dec. 1974. These are straight lines on a log-log plot.

..Note:: The equation in Hangartner Appendix I has a typo, the B term should be subtracted.

Parameters

s_range (ValueRange[scalar or Dim]) –

Stress range to use, valid when \(\sigma_{mean} \leq 30 ksi\). If no units are supplied, stresses are assumed to be ksi.

Note

To handle cases where \(\sigma_{mean} < 0\) a conservative simplification is made by setting \(\sigma_{mean} = 0\).

Returns

n – Calculated life (number of cycles).

Return type

integer

Raises

ValueError – If \(\sigma_{mean} > 30 ksi\).
